poem:
**Prime Time**

Tonight, in the flickering light,  
Robbie the binman sheds his skin,  
sorting not trash but lives  
in Philadelphia's quiet suburbs.  
By day, a father's slow, steady dance;  
by night, a shadow moving with Cliff,  
both caught in the camera's frame—  
a world tilting on the edge of crime,  
where even grief sparkles gently.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: Mark Ruffalo stars in new drama by Mare of Easttown creator Task 9pm, Sky AtlanticA compelling start for this new crime drama from the creator of Mare of Easttown, set in the Philadelphia suburbs. Robbie (Tom Pelphrey) is a binman by day, coping with the death of his brother while looking after his kids and niece, and maybe even looking for love. By night, though, he and his mate Cliff (Raúl Castillo) dress". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
